job_title: Certified Activity Director in Flint, MI
cons: no room for advancement or career improvement

pros: the pay was the only ok thing. But if you were in management like I was, you don't get paid for overtime. So be aware of that.
cons: They have little interaction with management and staff.

pros: Good pay flexible hours training advances
The mission is amazing and you get to help great people do cool things. Most employees are passionate about the mission and their work and just want to help others.
cons: COVID-19 has created a siloed culture and it is hard to work and communicate across teams, making you feel very isolated at times.

pros: lots of ways to gain experience
As much overtime as your body can handle
cons: It is reminiscent of a Nicaraguan prison labor camp, but atleast they don't have to commute to work

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Rocky Point, NY
Direct Support Professional in Columbia, MO
pros:
Got Great college job.  
The more you put into the job, the more you get out.  Every day you have a chance to make someone's life better.
Decent pay and benefits.
Fairly flexible with scheduling.
cons:
The most frustrating part of working at Woodhaven was my co-workers.  I felt like many (most?) of my co-workers, including supervisors, could barely take care of themselves, much less take care of the clients.
Paperwork can be a drag.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Columbia, MO
pros: They pay decently, do good work assisting individuals w disabilities.  They have an amazing training program here. I've worked at other places but they are known around the state for their training classes
cons: They have a a habit of letting the good employees slide though the cracks.    They let lies and gossip get to their employees and sometimes don't follow their own advice

review_title: Woodhaven is a place where anyone who is open-minded and willing can find substantial personal growth.
pros: Wonderful training in all areas important to job duties.  Some positions allow flexibility. Woodhaven does its appreciate Direct Support Staff.
cons: Not enough opportunities for career advancement. Upper management could be more supportive and understanding to lower management and to non-management.
People don't leave so not much room for growth.

pros: Excellent company, worked for past management. Tom Nathan, Stephanie Urban.
